description: n! / {product of factorials of the digits of n}.
comments: It can be shown that the terms obtained by the above formula are positive integers using the fact that k! divides a product of k consecutive numbers.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=0,...,100
prog: (PARI) { for (n=0, 100, p=1; x=n; until (x==0, p*=(x - 10*(x\10))!; x\=10); write("b061603.txt", n, " ", n!/p) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 25 2009]
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, May 19 2001
extensions: Corrected and extended by _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 19 2001
